tool.name: metfrag-cli-batch-multiple
tool.description: Run MetFrag with a multiple parameter set on one node.
tool.command: mkdir metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_output_1; bash /usr/local/bin/run_metfrag.sh -pp $metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_input_1 -r metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_output_1 -rn true #if $metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_database_file != "None" -l "$metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_database_file" #end if #if $additionalparameters: -a "$additionalparameters" #end if

param.name: metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_input_1
param.label: File collection with MetFrag parameters
param.help: File collection containing MetFrag parameters which are generated by msms2metfrag

param.name: additionalparameters
param.label: Additional Parameters
param.help: Additional parameters that can be passed to MetFrag. This can include e.g. access information for a local MetChem database instance

param.name: metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_database_file
param.label: Database File
param.help: File containing candidates used as database

===================== MetFrag CLI Batch =====================
----------- Description -----------
| This module is used to run MetFrag on annotated MS/MS spectra for compound annotation. The parameters are set by **msms2metfrag**.
----------- Input files -----------
+------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +==============================+============+ | 1) File collection with | txt | | MetFrag parameters | | +------------------------------+------------+ | 2) Database File (optional) | csv | +------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
File collection with MetFrag parameters | File collection containing MetFrag parameters which are generated by **msms2metfrag** |
Additional Parameters | Additional parameters that can be passed to MetFrag. This can include e.g. access information for a local MetChem database instance |
Database File | File containing candidates used as database |
------------ Output files ------------
metfrag_cli_batch_multiple_output_1.csv | A csv output file with scored candidates and properties |
